reviews.text:
The St. Mary of Blachernae Church  is a Byzantine church in Berat, Albania. It is named after the famous Church of St. Mary of Blachernae, near the Palace of Blachernae in Constantinople. It is believed that the church was built on the foundations of a ruined 5th century church that existed at the same place. The church is regarded as one of Berat's most important historical and architectural monuments and is a key tourist attraction for both Berat and Albania.

The church dates mainly from the 13th century and contains impressive frescoes and icons on its interior walls and ground from the 16th century. The paintings that dates from the 16th century were mostly produced by Nicholas Onufri, the son of the more famous Onufri
Impressive historic location, not a destination unless you're dealing with NYC Parks admin. Close enough to zoo, cafes, etc. within central park!
I need to come here more often...enough said.
What's the entry fee. Want to go with kids

I'm originally from Chicago and relocated to Burlington to study at one of the local colleges. Upon my first semester in school, Red Square welcomed me to be a resident DJ at their venue - which later turned into two residencies per week. Red Square has always been there for me and helped me advance in my DJ passion and my efforts to be a professional marketer.

The Red Square environment is fun and exciting! As a DJ, I always see our guests enjoying themselves and having a memorable time. There are multiple stages in the venue that DJs and live bands perform on throughout the week. That being said, Red Square is the place to be for an array of music.
Great drinks & staff.  Always a good time!  Nothing better then a summer night having drinks on their patio and listening to music!!

I'm giving this 3 stars as bring a bit of an older couple it seemed more of a dive bar. they had live music which was fun, a lounge area and a dance and DJ area in the back. it seemed a little different than what we are used to and being a big beer drinker we stopped in for a drink. My fiance said the shock top didnt taste like normal and my ipa left a dry aftertaste in my mouth. so I'm not sure if I'd be returning. it was clean inside and friendly staff just not sure if it's a place for me.

WAY BIGGER THAN IT LOOKS! Step inside to a small dining like area and step up to the dance floor. A DJ room in the back corner and live music outside in the summer time. Only downside is the bathroom situation, (especially for gents apparently) but other than that, an awesome place to hang with friends.

What fun night life! We were in the area for a wedding and stopped in for late night drinks. The band you had was very entertaining and we ended up staying for a couple hours. Dancing, drinking, socializing...Thanks for the experience
It was really good. better than Colorado springs McDonald's.. Everything was fresh thank you

The coke machine is always broken, service is crapy, and the wait is not worth the food. You could go somewhere for better food and get it faster. If you are in a rush go somewhere else, this place is not worth it. To top it all off it is not kid friendly anymore. They have electronic devices that don’t even work half the time. I went once and a baby got run over by a high chair. NOT kid friendly at all.
My weakness! Always a crowd but worth the wait. This location one of the cleanest for being so busy.
Wow looks really nice, so modern, good customer service and they have some good deals.

Nasty food..filthy restaurant .. I am so fed up with the sorry excuse for customer service. I came in today and ordered chicken nuggets, no dipping sauce but 2 packs of mayo, they charged me for the mayo, then tried to give me someone elses food. after they handed my food to the car in front of me, they gave me the same food without replacing it. This place is a horrible location. I will never go back to this location. The sad thing is the owners could care less.
